page.title: 09TRANSPORT IN MADDERTY
page.content: There is a lack of public transport in Madderty. One bus makes two journeys a day from Crieff to Perth via Madderty, once in the morning and once in the evening. Anyone travelling into Perth on the morning bus has to wait until tea time before they can make the return journey. There is a school contract bus which takes pupils into the Secondary School in Crieff on which members of the public can travel. Again they cannot return until four o'clock when the pupils return. Any pupils wishing to attend clubs or sports after school have to be collected by their parents,as there is no other service bus. A car is therefore essential here. Older people without a car have to rely on the goodwill of neighbours.
